title: Understanding Depersonalization
text: Depersonalization involves a feeling of detachment from oneself. It is important to recognize how this differs from other dissociative symptoms.

hintAnswer: an alteration in the perception or experience of oneself, where an individual may feel detached or estranged from their thoughts, feelings, body, or actions
title: Identifying Depersonalization
text: Which of the following best describes depersonalization?
choices: unexpected or unplanned travel and amnesia regarding one’s identity, and $$\frac{depersonalization}{derealization}$$ disorder, marked by feelings of detachmentfrom oneself or their surroundings
Dissociative Experiences Scale (DES) or the Structured Clinical Interview for Dissociative Disorders $$(SCID-D)$$
an alteration in the perception or experience of oneself, where an individual may feel detached or estranged from their thoughts, feelings, body, or actions
process of synthesizing different aspects of a person’s identity, experience, and functioning into a cohesive and harmonious whole
